definition: to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: David Jones rose to reply for the guests.
sentences.chinese: 大卫琼斯站起来代表来宾致答辞。

sentences.english: Laibin city police in Guangxi broke up a gambling ring running a racket called "mark-six lottery".
sentences.chinese: 来宾市警方粉碎了一个六合彩赌博集团。

sentences.english: Lavish gifts were bestowed on the visitors.
Nobody will publish your guest posts, and nobody will link to you.
sentences.chinese: 没人会发表你的来宾发帖，也不会有人链接你。

sentences.english: The pastor showed the marriage certificate to all of the guests.
sentences.chinese: 牧师向所有来宾展示了他们的结婚证书。

sentences.english: The visitors will be shown around Nantong City and some other surrounding counties.
sentences.chinese: 来宾将被带领参观南通市及其周围的县镇。

sentences.english: In addition, the emulator provides a true isolation of the guest from the host.
sentences.chinese: 此外，仿真器提供了来宾机器与主机的真正隔离。

sentences.english: Would you please sign our visitors' book?
sentences.chinese: 请在来宾簿上签个名好吗？

sentences.english: We really wanted to create an experience for our guests.
sentences.chinese: 我们很想让来宾们能有一番不一样的体验。

sentences.english: The headvertisementswaiter was debonair with the guests but firm with the waiters.
sentences.chinese: 领班对来宾温文有礼，但是对侍者却很倔强。

sentences.english: Let's give three cheers for the visitors.
sentences.chinese: 让我们向来宾三次欢呼。

sentences.english: The Visitors' Centre amalgamates the traditions of the Old World with the technology of the New.
sentences.chinese: 来宾中心将欧洲的传统与美洲的技术结合在一起。

sentences.english: We have been surprised by the full house and the great response.
sentences.chinese: 我们也很惊讶且高兴满场的来宾及热烈的回应。

sentences.english: He stood up to reply for the guests.
sentences.chinese: 他站起来代表来宾致答词。

sentences.english: Dance with ushers and any single male guests who ask them.
sentences.chinese: 和迎宾员和单身男来宾一起跳舞。

definition: variant of 嘉賓|嘉宾[jia1 bin1]
meeting place/place where people gather/CL:個|个[ge4]
to welcome a guest/to entertain a customer (of prostitute)
